title: (x) Serendipity movie poster - Licorice {Justin}
content:
It's similar to many including Nick Curtis Pleasingly Plump but no cigar. Anybody recognize this critter? Any help appreciated.   
   
This is fromt the movie "Serendipity"'s home video cover   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42289.jpg)   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42290.jpg)
author: jamiegareth

comments.content: Looks like a not very good knock-off of [Spumoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540/http:/store.adobe.com/type/browser/P/P_423.jhtml).
Mark - what do you mean by - not very good knock-off ?
He means that someone recreated another typeface and did not do a very good job at it.

The lower case looks exactly like Spumoni, and the upper case looks like Spumoni with added/modified serifs. I agree with Mark.   
   
For comparison, there are three other commercial fonts that have a strong stylistic resemblance to Spumoni (none of them match the samples):   
 [Elroy](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm?sku=SD10101) by Christian Schwartz;   
 [Heatwave](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540/http:/www.fonthaus.com/products/fonts/view.cfm?sku=PN10131) by Panache Graphics;   
and Sniff by Joan Barjau of Type-O-Tones (sample follows). Sniff has the most 'embellishment', but has the same sort of casual feel that I get from Spumoni.   
   
The Nick Curtis font is all caps and is based (apparently) on Goudy Stout, which it resembles, with added bounce.   
   
 ![Sniff sample](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42310.gif)

Thanks for the help guys. This is very interesting. Why not just use Spumoni? It's relatively cheap and readily available, especially for a commercial product like a movie cover. Is there perhaps another Spumoni knockoff floating around somewhere?   
   
Here's the full cover, BTW.   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42336.jpg)

Licorice from Bright Ideas seems to match. According to [Luc's free fonts page](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540/http:/cgm.cs.mcgill.ca/~luc/originalfonts.html), Bright Ideas fonts came bundled with a magazine. I think they were mostly knockoffs, I'm not sure where you'd find them now.   
   
 ![licorice](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/42351.gif)
Wow, thanks Justin. That's an amazing ID! You've made my day. ![:-)](http://web.archive.org/web/20050518125540im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/clipart/happy.gif)
